titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Mary-Ann Palmieri collection of Frances Crowe interviews SSC.MS.00789
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-18 15:07:33 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.unittitle: Mary-Ann Palmieri collection of Frances Crowe interviews
did.abstract: The collection contains various interviews done with Frances Crowe, pacivist and activist, and a copy of Crowe's memoir, "Finding My Radical Soul"

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was gifted by Mary Paqlmieri in 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mary-Ann Palmieri assisted Frances Crowe in the writing of Crowe's memoir.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mary-Ann Palmieri Collection of France Crowe Interviews, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00789, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various interviews done with Frances Crowe and a copy of Crowe's memoir, "Finding My Radical Soul"

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Palmieri has licensed her materials to be freely used, so long as the user attributes materials' original authorship to her. This agreement is governed by a CC-BY (Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International) license. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Palmieri, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
